description: I love this place when i decide to go out close to home.  I love the bartenders and their stiff stiff drinks!  It's just a really chill and laid back place and the people are pretty cool.  It gets pretty crowded but it goes in waves.  There is also a pool table so that's another plus too as far as dive bars go.
author: Kirsten M.

description: My memories of the Buccaneer are a little vague....mainly because I showed up drunker than I thought I was. But in my state, I was excessively generous and bought everyone I was with a couple rounds. I ordered a lot of drinks, all of which were served to me quickly. And they were strong. This place doesn't claim to be anything it's not. It's a solid bar filled with happy people.
author: Veronica W.

description: My new favorite bar.  I have just discovered this place and I am so happy I did.  The drinks are cheap and the crowd is not too marina, not too mission, which is my perfect blend.  Plus they have a jukebox that plays The Cure, Bowie and Johnny Cash so I am set.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
used to live at the corner of polk/broadway and would frequent here much...Pool-table,Jukebox,Drinks= Fuckin Good time!!!
and Nick's Tacos a few buildings over..Hell Yeah
author: David c.

description: Great bar. People on here all call it a dive but I wouldn't take it that far. It is small and cozy. On a cold night they have a fire going in their little wood burning stove, there is a pool table in back, the bartenders always have the best music playing, and best of all they allow dogs! It's a great place to head during the week as it gets a little packed on the weekend. Love the Buc!! Thanks so much for letting us bring our pup in!
author: e w.

description:
I freaking love the Buc! 

I freaking love the Buc!

Buc buc buc!

It's stuffy, smelly, and strange, and I cannot get enough of it.

Thank you Marty, Teague, Jill, Starla, and Adam. I heart you all.
author: Jenna F.

description: This place is just special. Definitely a dive bar but in the middle of one of the richest areas in San Francisco. Go figure. The bartenders are great, and yes as other reviewers have said, good looking too. They have a pool table which is always awesome. I think what I like the most about this place is the diversity. It is not a trendy place. People are not here for a scene. No one is obnoxious just all there to have a drink or two or three and a good time. Tons of regulars, including this adorable dog who has mastered the art of sitting on a bar stool and chillin'. What more can you ask for in a bar?
author: Heather L.

description: This to me is a classic Start-or-Finish bar.  You want to either start your night here or finish it here.  If you start your night here you can assemble the crew and start building up a head of steam, then move on to someplace a little better for group conviviality.  If you finish your night here, you want your crew to have been pared down to 3 or maybe 4 through barhopping attrition, then commandeer a corner with barstools--preferably one of the ass-shaped ones customized by Denis Jensen.  Things get a little handsy here at times too which can be fun.  I won't even mention crushes on bartenders that someone I know has had.
author: Kevin S.

description: Ah....Bucs.  My Sunday Savior.  A place where the staff and clientele are just as divey as the bar - J/K!  lol The customers and staff are super cool and friendly and all of 'em seem like the are from the neighborhood. A very comfortable bar to kick back and knock down some cold ones while meeting some good peeps.  See ya on Sunday!
author: Don C.

description: Great dive bar, just the way I like it.  I walk in without checking my ID, order drinks which are tasty.  And I especially loved that they were playing my song, by the Beatles... you know, the one with my name.  So it was pleasant and seriously a great location, good peeps, groovy music, and entertaining.  And just far enough away from the marina.
author: Michelle N.

description: Conveniently located within stumbling distance of my buddy's place, we had ourselves quite the Monday night here. I made the mistake of going for my usual belvedere tonic, 2 limes bit here, and rectified that mistake rather quickly! Good pool table, good crowd, cheap as hell, what else can you ask for in a dive bar?
author: Irene F.

description: Another one of my favorite local hangouts. The bartender is THE COOLEST. He gave us great deals on drinks during Halloween. The pool table keeps you entertained...the writing and bathroom art even more so. It's missing one star for the loser girl who kept trying to makeout with guys, I think she tried 3 different ones before her friend drug her home....silly drunks. The music is also great...as everyone else says...cheap beer, great music, pool and ARRRRRG...a good time!
author: Cassy R.

description: This is a great place when you're bar hopping on Polk. They don't water down drinks and the bartenders are really nice. The place looks like the bowels of a huge ship which is awesome. The one pool table kind of sucks because people hog it all night. It makes me wonder why they have a pool table at all.
author: Jenny C.

description: My favorite dive bar in the city. The bartenders here remember you, the beers are cheap (3.50 boddingtons all day everyday), and the inside of the bar looks like a pirate ship. All pluses in my book. I grab weeknight beers here and occasionally start or finish my weekend nights here. Shots flow like wine and I always have a great time here. In the winter the fireplace gets going, turning this bar into the perfect dive bar for guinness drinking. The only knock on the Buc is its a patriots bar.
author: Garrett M.

description: The kick ass bartender's name is Audrey.
author: Shelby S.

description: Best bar on Polk street hands down.  The drinks are strong, the bartenders are cool, and the patrons are drunk and friendly.  They have a great jukebox and will play good rock music, even when the jukebox isn't rolling.  Get a seat by the window so that you can mingle with the people on the street.
author: Jake A.

description: Finally came in after passing by many times.  I probaly would never walk in if my friend didn't bring me here.  It was cool that they let dogs inside too...although  I'm not really a pet person.  I only had beer on tap so can't say much for the cocktails....but regulars here did tell me that they make awesome bloody mary's.  I'll probaly try it the next time I am in the neighborhood.  One thing that did get me was the bathroom...must it be that gross. Overall...seems like a cool neighborhood bar to hang at.
author: Allison T.

description:
My old roommate adores the Buccaneer, so much so that even though he moved to NYC nearly two years ago, he just wrote to me to ask if the Buc still has free pool, because he plans on coming back to San Francisco for the summer.  

I had to let him down, gently.  I've heard that they're charging for the eight ball these days.

So, no free pool.  But they do have a table.  One table.  One highly desired table.  

They've also got a two bathrooms.  Two really, really disgusting bathrooms.  I'm not even going to go into it here.

So, a busy pool table, two nasty restrooms, and...drinks!  And an OK-so-so crowd.  Two stars.
author: Hannah J.

description: " I was born in a cross-fire hurricane" This is a chic dive with an excellent location, that you can bring your Polkers, Nick Taco's, or now escape from NY pizza into while you enjoy affordable drinks and an excellent juke box. Its an unpretensious bar in a pretensious neighborhood- a bit like a diamond in the rough. I love The Buc, and cannto wait to drink there again watching sports on their new flatscreens.
author: M P.

description: I heard 'Sweetie may I see your ID.' I was certain he wasn't speaking to me...I'm 35 damnit! Well he was speaking to me...and he was very cuuuute. The doorman/bouncer/ID man at this way too many 20 somethings bar is too damn nice. I stayed a total of 5 minutes to pick up my friend...and then we were out of there. Way too crowded for me to feel comfortable- they all looked like they were having fun. Nice Bostonian vibe.
author: Sherie R.

description: Best place in SF for a Mass-hole to be hole.  This is the place to be for a big Boston game.  When the Sawx won the world series, this place was so packed that literally my glasses fogged up and wouldn't unfog.  In my blind stupor, I hugged a lot people (and generally im not a hugger), got really sweaty, literally picked up people like Papelbon picked up JV after the final out, and sang along to Sweet Caroline and Dirty Water.
author: S. K.

description: This place is a good divey bar.  Full of regulars and the bartenders were very friendly too - he let me have a sip of his coffee, bailey and jameson drink - very yummy.
author: Annabel G.

description: Buc is probably where you should try to end up b/w the hours of 10&12 on a Friday night if you're the type of person that a. likes the pixies - full juke box representation, b. likes bartenders that offer quick service & are way mellow, c. is okay at pool, but still enjoys winning ( the people that play there are more interested in talking than sinking balls -  representative of the general attitude in the place ) and/or d. like drinking in a relaxed environment with friends who write obscenities under your name on the pool board - then take pictures of it and use it as their facebook picture - for an extended period of time.. highly recommend giving the place a try
author: Sean M.

description: This is the best place for myself and my roommates to get drunk on a random weeknight.  Why? Because it's two blocks from our house, the bartenders are some of the best around, and the jukebox is packed with decent music.    As an added bonus,  if you get hungry, the Walgreen's across the street turns a blind eye to drunks wandering up and down the aisles tearing open and devouring bags of kettle chips.
author: chris w.

description: Yup, they had me at pirates.  And good beers on tap...
author: L C.

description: Nice place, chill atmosphere, great bartenders, fun crowd.  Enjoy some drinks there during the week and be able to partake in intelligent conversation simultaneously.
author: ellyk E.

description: Very crowded old school dive bar that's not really my idea for fun but when I got 3 drinks and the bill turned out to be less than $20; I became a huge fan.  Its a good night anytime a Jackson note can buy a round of liquor.
author: Ed L.

description: The possibility of seeing Denis Jensen here is enough to give the Buc five sexy stars.
author: Nish N.

description: Been here about a half dozen times, and have never been disappointed.  There is always a decent crowd.  The drinks are strong and reasonably priced.  It has always been a stop over in between different bars, but I could definitely spend the whole evening here, drinking my face off.  And how can you not love pirates?
author: Robert R.

description: Starting here before heading out to dance is ideal as it has a sports/frats/relaxed atomosphere. I found the bartenders to be nice and the patrons (mostly men) offered seats to us girls. How sweet.
author: Kat C.

description: Yet one more place where I've been with someone I shouldn't have been with. It seems like a fine place to drink, but I doubt I'll spend enough time here to find out.
author: Rene D.

description: This is probably not the type of place you want to go out of your way for.  It is okay in size and the drinks are decently priced, but there is nothing amazingly special about this place.  I live near the place, so I frequent a lot because it is a good starting spot for me.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I don't usually hang out in the Russian Hill neighborhood since I live in the Western Addition / Panhandle part of town but I came here on a friend's suggestion since a few of my out of towner friends are here on business.  It's your typical dive bar with the pool table in the back.  The bartender was very nice and tolerant of our drunkenness and served us our drinks quickly and efficiently.  The whole bar itself is not too big and kind of cramped and the jukebox could've used some work....too much old stuff.  Would I make the effort to come back here?  Probably not.
author: David C.

description: I love the Bucc.  Cheap, stiff drinks.  Great bartenders!  This is my neighborhood bar.  I think I might go right now.
author: Lauren M.

description: Any dive-bar that is dog-friendly get's 5 stars in my book!  Other than that, there isn't anything exceptional about, but it's well located and doesn't force me to leave my furry little friend at home.
author: Cristina C.

description: The Buc is A-OK in my book.  Nothing fancy, special, original or interesting about this place, but it's a decent place to drop in and have one drink.  I'm not sure about any more then one, but I have my other watering holes that I can (and have) spend an entire day in.
author: Ayrn H.

description: I would definitely come back....nice strong drinks at a reasonable price, decent crowd & attentive bartenders...what more could you ask for in a watering hole?
author: Natacha M.

description: Cool bar.  Hate the pool table in the back on a crowded night.  I like the feel though...good scene.
author: Jaime C.

description: Here are my buccaneer's, where are your buccaneyes?  Buc's is such a fun part of the Polk street crawl that I only realized last weekend where it is in daylight.  Never a dissapointing time, unless you hate a densely packed bar.
author: Tracy E.

description: This place is okay but there are too many better bars within a one block radius to really consider going here. The pool table is okay and they get an extra star for having a super cute dog here. Otherwise it's kind of boring and the clientele tend to be the loud spillovers from Greens.
author: Cathy T.

description:
love this place!! the perfect divey bar to chill with friends or sit and have an after work drink. the bartender was super nice, attentive, and quick with the refills. we had 6 drinks and our bill was only $20!! i like it! 

everyone in the bar was pretty friendly and i will def be going back!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Favorite bar in san francisco.... with teague, marty or jill behind the bar you can't go wrong. Tip 'em well. They're worth it.

Would like to see soap in the mens bathroom. That's my only complaint.
author: Dave H.

description: The Buc is great!  A perfect neighborhood dive bar.
author: Cameron M.

description: Not a bad vibe.. crowd is friendly and unassuming.  On plus side, you can purchase a round of drinks without walking down to the ATM for some extra Green... worth a trip! I would recommend watching a sporting event when either the Redsox or Pats are playing and then the place really gets going.
author: Tom C.

description: This place is so cramped and loud it makes me want to jump ship.
author: Helen C.

description: Friendly bartenders and cheap drinks! I'd give it five stars but there's a "frat-boy" element to the bar.
author: Leesa P.

description: Drink and shoot some pool or play some liar's dice. If you're a guy, you must wear a t-shirt and ball cap to enter.
author: Dave L.

description: There was a lot of pushing around at this bar-- the kind where if you are somewhat brown you get manhandled like you were part of the furniture. I'm not really into that. Due to all of the jostling and 'brown is part of the decor' mentality, I could never make it up to the bar to order a drink. Not such a fan.
author: Yaamini R.

description: Great bar, nice bartenders, not overly expensive drinks, pool table and juke box.  Keep it simple
author: Corey V.

description: You can bring in your dog, u can bring in snacks.  This is something I can get behind.  I assume this is an affordable watering hole, i was not picking up the tab, so i can't vouch for price points.  But if you're in this neighborhood it is a good time.
author: Nicole F.

description: great bar good people both work and patronize the place but go early  it gets way to crowded late. NEVER play dice against Teuge, he will beat you.
author: michael h.

description:
I had to pick this bar as my first review on yelp.  I love it.  love, love, love it.  Here is why:
1.  The bartenders are friendly and fast
2.  The drinks are strong
3.  There are pool tables
4.  Dogs are allowed.
5.  The crowd is young, laid-back, and not too marina-ish despite the location

I would say the only negative to this place is the bathrooms.  They need some serious work.  Just drink enough and you won't notice and/or care.
author: Caedmon P.

description: I might be biased because the bartenders there comped us a couple drinks and a round of shots, but based on the bartenders alone, this place is awesome.  Not living in San Fran, I can really only compare it to the place that was around the corner from my hotel (Club 93 I believe it was called...) but on a universal bar scale, it was pretty much what you want in a bar.  I wish there was a way to review a bar separate of its clientele, cuz in reality it seem like there was a half star's worth of wanker deduction warranted... but half stars aren't available on yelp so I'll give em 5.
author: jorbi p.

description: They have their own dog, what more could you ask for?!  Classic dive bar, 1 pool table, some random old stove/heater in the middle of the joint and genuine good people.
author: Andrew N.

description: If you end up at the Buc, be sure and save my seat for me at the bar. It's the seat that looks like it was shaped by my ass. Say hello to Tony and Tiegue and try your hand at a Boddingtons.
author: Denis J.

description: This place is one of the best dive bars in SF...period.  Its a sure good time with cheap ass drinks.
author: Charles C.

description: Just went last night for the first time in a long time. Oh how I love this place. Fun down to earth people having a good ol time. So unpretentious cheap and FUN!
author: kerry L.

description: Not too big, but a Great place to find Boston/New England Fans...I will be back to watch the Patriots games!
author: Rita M.

description:
This place is a really fun bar. It can be chill and easy-going or really packed and rowdy. The bartenders are very nice and drinks are good.
What more do you need?
Oh, you can bring your pooch in too :)
author: Nicole R.

description: Great local bar with a friendly atmosphere, great service, and young crowd.
author: Eric W.

description: my favorite boston sports bar in san francisco. if you're a new england transplant you'll feel right at home the moment you walk into the buccaneer. the bartenders are great and if you're hungry during the game, they're super cool about bringing in your own food. might i suggest some nick's crispy tacos next door?
author: Brian W.

description: Like most Yelpers to review this place, I dug the cheap drinks and friendly bartenders.  Games at the pool table are 50 cents, which is cheap too, I'd say.  The Sunday night crowd I encountered was mellow and polite, and included a four-legged friend that was treated with the reverence of a beloved regular.  The charge of too many frat boys didn't occur to me, but then again, I'm an East Coaster and so may not know what a CA fratty really looks like.  But my friend told me that many SF bars somehow become havens for transplanted sports fans - apparently, The Buccaneer is a fav among former Bostonians, as evidenced by the Patriots poster in the pool room.  As an East Coaster, I could certainly understand that!
author: Adam B.

description: Came here the other night and left a very happy & tipsy customer.  The people were all great and the bartenders were friendly + speedy.  They have good beers for cheap - like Beck's and Corona's - only 4 bucks.  The Boddington's is a good pour.  And a $3.50 menu exists for the truly budget minded.  The next day as I was digging through my wallet to see what financial damage I had done the night before, I was delighted to see that I only spent $25 at the Buc.  Now that's what I call good bang for my Buc!  The only detractor was a nasty puke in the men's room that was left uncleaned the whole time I was there, but I won't let that spoil my image of the place.  Hey, at least it was in the bathroom, right?  I will be returning here again and again, and soon, everyone "will know my name".  [cue piano]
author: ardian b.

description: Good bar, good prices and great bartenders.  The buc is a good place to go and enjoy a couple drinks with the diverse croud and a nice mix of regulars.  If you are a Yankees fan this might not be your place, the buc is dominated by sox fans (and bartenders).  Usually a good ratio (m/f) of good looking people here, good amount of people during the weekdays, but if you don't like being overcrowded you might want to avoid the weekends.
author: S T.

description: love the buck. went in last night with my amazing coworkers(minus lynsey c) nice chill spot awesome bear selection. marty is adorable and super sweet. can't wait for next sunday :)
author: Angelina M.

description: whenever i'm running around russion hill bar-hopping on polk street i always stop at the "Buc" for some drinks. its a good little bar with nice friendly laid-back bartenders and a fun young crowd.
author: Michelle I.

description: I wouldn't consider this a dive bar I would consider it a sports bar without the potato skins and burgers. The people here are fun and the bar staff is cool. I almost bought some of their underwear but was discouraged by a friend.
author: Daisy S.

description: i really enjoy the buc - no frills, good music most of the time, they have a pool table if thats your thing (its NOT mine, i am the worst pool player ever), and of course plenty of drinks.
author: Carolyn B.

description: we stopped in here on a girls' night out while waiting for a table at street (next door).  there was a kind of strange crowd of very drunk middle aged men dressed like frat boys, and normally i would've been kind of sketched out by them.  however, they bought us drinks, so i won't complain.  service appeared to be friendly (but the drunk old frat guys dealt with the bartenders, not us).  there was a cool jukebox and a pool table, so it made for a pretty laid back atmosphere.
author: Roshni R.

description: I lived a block away for years, Bartender Tony was my roommate, and I dated one of his best friends for a time...so needless to say, I spent many a night at the Buccaneer. I have been hypnotized by a real live magician there, won my first game of pool there, and ended too many bad dates down the street, only to head to the Buc to drown my sorrows before stumbling home. The booze is cheap, the staff is super duper nice and friendly, and the crowd doesn't suck. It's a good alternative to that creepy plant-infested place down the block and it sure as hell beats the crap out of Rouge, just a block away in the opposite direction from PlantLand. There will not be lots of girls in high heels with big hair, there will be no house or trance or breakbeats, there will not be peace and quiet, and there will probably be a rowdy drunk guy or two. But I like rowdy men and I like my bar music loud enough that I can't hear myself drunkenly singing along...
author: Autumn K.

description: good location, The Buc's got.  this much is certain.  the prices are alright, neither better nor worse than nearby Shangai Kelly's.  There's only one flaw, and it's a doozy for me - it smells like a sweat lodge for mice, or maybe an underground pirate bathroom.  it also gets busy.
author: Nic M.

description: Home away from home for All Boston area ex-pats.   The place to be Boston sports events.  I'd give it 5 stars if it had cleaner bathrooms...but what the hell it's a dive!
author: Peter J.
